subject: Re: [junit] Code coverage analysis with JUnit
msgSnippet: Also take a look at: http://java-source.net/open-source/code-coverage ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Tired of spam?
messageBody:
Also take a look at:
http://java-source.net/open-source/code-coverage

--- Wayne Fay <waynefay@...> wrote:

> I've been looking to add a code coverage tool to my
> new project's
> toolkit... Was looking at JCoverage, Clover, etc so
> this thread is
> very well-timed!
>
> I'm not hugely familiar with EMMA... Found the site
> easily enough...
> Wondering if anyone here is using Maven2 + JUnit +
> EMMA and has any
> advice to offer? Or a sample pom.xml? :-)
>
> Wayne
>
> On 2/14/06, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...>
> wrote:
> > I'm not sure how you define "large scale" but we
> are
> > using JUnit with EMMA on the commercial product
> under
> > development right now. EMMA does everything we've
> > needed so far, and so I don't feel any design to
> change.
> > But there are definitely other good coverage tools
> out
> > there, too.
> >
> > The cost of implementation is very low, as is the
> cost
> > of switching. So why not go with EMMA for now and
> if
> > you find it doesn't do something you need, switch
> it
> > out later?
> >
> >
> > Todd.
> >
>
>
>
